com.anthonyeden.jnm
Class Monitor

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.anthonyeden.jnm.Monitor
Direct Known Subclasses:
HttpMonitor, TCPMonitor
public abstract class Monitor
extends java.lang.Object

Standard base class which is extended by all JNM monitors. Implementations must implement the execute() method. Implementations may also implement the configure() method if they would like use configuration.

Author:
Anthony Eden

getMonitorEditor

public MonitorEditor getMonitorEditor()
                               throws java.lang.Exception
Get the MonitorEditor instance of this Monitor.
Returns:
The MonitorEditor

executeAsynchronously

public void executeAsynchronously()
Execute the Monitor in its own thread. This method is used by components which execute the monitor directly in order to have immediate feedback of the state of the target.

execute

public abstract void execute()
Execute the monitor's logic. Subclasses must implement this method to perform monitoring logic.

getActions

public com.anthonyeden.lib.util.XArrayList getActions(MonitorState state)
Return a List of actions which should be executed when the Monitor enters the given state. If no actions are defined then this method returns an empty List.

Note: this method returns an ArrayList in order to allow the cloning of the list.

Parameters:
state - The MonitorState
Returns:
an ArrayList of actions

readConfiguration

protected void readConfiguration(com.anthonyeden.lib.config.Configuration configuration)
                          throws com.anthonyeden.lib.config.ConfigurationException
This method is called after the basic Monitor configuration occurs. The default implementation is empty. Subclasses may override this method to be configured.
Parameters:
configuration - The configuration object
Throws:
com.anthonyeden.lib.config.ConfigurationException -  

writeConfiguration

protected void writeConfiguration(com.anthonyeden.lib.config.MutableConfiguration configuration)
                           throws com.anthonyeden.lib.config.ConfigurationException

getName

public java.lang.String getName()
Get the monitor name. If the monitor name is not set then the monitor implementation should try to provide something useful as the monitor name.
Returns:
The monitor name

setName

public void setName(java.lang.String name)
Set the monitor name. If the monitor name is not set then the monitor implementation should try to provide something useful as the monitor name.
Parameters:
name - The monitor name

setDefaultName

protected void setDefaultName(java.lang.String defaultName)
Set default name. This is the name to use if no name is specified. Monitor implementations should set this value to something descriptive.
Parameters:
defaultName - The name if no name is specified

getDelay

public int getDelay()
Get the monitor delay in milliseconds.
Returns:
The delay in milliseconds

setDelay

public void setDelay(int delay)
Set the monitor delay in milliseconds.
Parameters:
delay - The new delay in milliseconds

setDelay

public void setDelay(java.lang.String delay)
Set the monitor delay in milliseconds. This method will try to parse the given String into an Integer. If the argument is null then the DEFAULT_DELAY value is used.
Parameters:
delay - The new delay in milliseconds as a String

loadConfiguration

public final void loadConfiguration(com.anthonyeden.lib.config.Configuration configuration)
                             throws com.anthonyeden.lib.config.ConfigurationException
Load the Monitor's configuration. Subclasses should overload the readConfiguration() method if they want to use configuration information. The readConfiguration() method is called after all basic configuration is complete.

The following fields are always configured here:

  • name
  • delay
    • Parameters:
    configuration - The configuration object
    Throws:
    com.anthonyeden.lib.config.ConfigurationException -  

    saveConfiguration

    public final void saveConfiguration(com.anthonyeden.lib.config.MutableConfiguration configuration)
                             throws com.anthonyeden.lib.config.ConfigurationException
